meteringrange: EV 0 ~ EV 20 at 23° C (73° F), 50mm f/1.4 lens, ISO 100
isospeedrange: For Stills: 1) Manual Setting Range: 100 ~ 12,800, expansion to ISO 25,600 2) Auto: ISO 100 ~ 6,400 (in whole-stop increments) Shooting Mode ISO Settings Auto, Flash OFF, Creative Auto, Landscape, Close-up, Sports, Night Portrait, HDR Backlight Control mode 100 ~ 6,400 Night Landscape 100 - 12,800 Portrait 100 P, TV, Av, M 100 ~ 6,400 With Flash 400
shutterspeeds: 1/4,000 to 1/60 seconds, X-sync at 1/200 seconds (Scene Intelligent Auto) -  With a wide-angle lens, the shutter may be 1/60 sec. or slower. 1/4,000 to 30 sec., bulb, X-sync at 1/200 seconds - Settable in 1/3- or 1/2-stop increments.
afworkingrange: EV -0.5 ~ 18 at room temperature and ISO 100, based on Canon's testing standards
drivemodes: Single Continuous 10 second self-timer / remote control 2 second self-timer Continuous shooting after 10-second self-timer (2 to 10 shots)
batterycheck: - Automatic battery level check when power is turned ON. - Battery level indicated in one of four levels on LCD monitor.
externalflashsettings: 1) External flash function setting -   Flash firing, E-TTL II auto flash system, flash mode, wireless master, zoom, sync setting, flash exposure compensation, FEB, and clear setting. * -   With the 600EX-RT, radio wireless transmission control is possible. 2) External flash C.Fn setting Actual settings for 1) and 2) differ based on the Speedlite used.
picturestyle: Auto,       Standard, Portrait, Landscape, Neutral, Faithful, Monochrome, User Defined 1, 2 and 3
rawjpegsimultaneousrecording: Yes, supports RAW + JPEG Simultaneous Recording
settings: Auto, Preset (Daylight; Shade; Cloudy, Twilight, Sunset; Tungsten light; White Fluorescent Light; Flash), Custom (~2,000 to 10,000°K), White Balance Correction, and White Balance Bracketing
recordingfunctions: 1) Standard - Records to either the CF card or SD card. 2) Auto switch card -  When the current card becomes full, the camera switches to the other card automatically. 3) Record separately - The CF card and SD card record the same image at a different image recording quality (L, M, S1, S2, S3, RAW, M-RAW, S-RAW) 4) Record to multiple - Both the CF card and SD card record the same image at the same image recording quality. (Also applies to RAW+JPEG, M+JPEG, and SRAW+JPEG)
griddisplay: 1) Grid 1: Pair of vertical and horizontal lines 2) Grid 2: 5 vertical and 3 horizontal lines
exposurecontrol: 1) Program AE for movie shooting - In Basic Zone modes, P, Av, and Tv modes - Shutter speed 1/30 - 1/4000 sec. (Signal accumulation time), aperture, and ISO speed automatically set. 2) Manual exposure - For manual exposure. Shutter speed (signal accumulation time), aperture, and ISO speed (auto/manual) manually set. The shutter speed (signal accumulation time) is limited to 1/4000 sec. at the maximum and to 1/30 sec. at the minimum for 24/25/30 fps or 1/60 sec. or higher for 50/60 fps depending on the frame rate.
weight: Body Only: 525g (18.5 oz) Lens Only: 480g (16.9 oz) Combined: 730g (35.4 oz / 2 lb 3.4 oz)
erase: Erase single image, erase selected images, erase all images in folder, erase all images on a card, or erase only unprotected images.
mirror: Quick-return Half Mirror: (Transmission: reflection ratio of 40 : 60)
afassistbeam: 1) Intermittent firing of built-in flash 2) Effective range: ~ 4M / 13.2 ft. at center, ~3.5m / 11.5 ft. at periphery
shutterlagtime: 1) During SW-1 ON, time lag between SW-2 ON and start of exposure:  0.075 second 2) Time lag between simultaneous SW-1/SW-2 ON and start of exposure: ~0.150 second Time lag with the aperture stopped down by 3.5 stops or less, excludes AF operation time.
aelock: 1) Auto AE lock - In the One-Shot AF mode with evaluative metering, AE lock takes effect when focus is achieved. 2) Manual AE lock - In the P, Tv, Av, and M modes, enabled with the AE lock button. (Press again to update) - Enabled in all metering modes.
mymenuregistration: Up to six top-tier menu options and Custom Function settings can be registered
colortemperaturecompensation: Blue / Amber bias: ±9 levels Magenta / Green bias: ±9 levels Corrected in reference to the current WB mode's color temperature. Color Temperature Information Transmission Provided
highlightalert: On the detailed information and histogram displays, highlight areas with no image data will blink.
datetimebattery: Built-in secondary battery maintains the Date/Time. - It is not replaceable by the user, but recharges when a LP-E8 is loaded or when the AC adapter is connected. - Without any recharging, the backup battery can maintain the date/time for ~ 3 months. - This backup battery takes ~ 8 hours to be fully recharged.
shootingmodes: Still photo shooting and video recording
items: When you press the Quick Control function button under the following conditions, you can set the functions below: - Settable functions depend on the shooting mode 1) With viewfinder shooting:  Shutter speed, aperture, ISO speed, exposure compensation, AEB, flash exposure compensation, Picture Style, white balance, Auto Lighting Optimizer, built-in flash function setting, AF mode, drive mode, metering mode, and image recording quality. 2) With Live View shooting:  AF mode, drive mode, white balance, Picture Style, Auto Lighting Optimizer, image-recording quality, and built-in flash function setting. 3) With video shooting:  AF mode, white balance, Picture Style, Auto Lighting Optimizer, image recording quality (stills), video-recording size, and video snapshot.
protection: Erase protection can be applied or canceled for a single image, all images in a folder, or all images on the card.
fileformat: MOV: Movie: MPEG-4 AVC / H.264 -           Variable (average) bit rate Audio: Linear PCM -   Meta information is embedded in the MOV file (no separate THM file)
powersaving: Power turns off after a set time of non-operation: 30 seconds, 1, 2, 4, 8, 15 or disabled
interfacelanguages: 25;  English, German, French, Dutch, Danish, Portuguese, Finnish, Italian, Norwegian, Swedish, Spanish, Greek, Russian, Polish, Czech, Hungarian, Romanian, Ukraine, Turkish, Arabic, Thai, Simplified and Traditional Chinese, Korean and Japanese
battery: 1x LP-E8 Battery Pack - With the optional AC Adapter Kit ACK-E8, AC power is possible. - With the optional Battery Grip BG-E8, it is possible to use two Battery Pack LP-E8 units.
recordingmedia: SD card, SDHC card, SDXC memory card. Compatible with Ultra High-Speed (UHS-I) memory cards. Compatible with Eye-Fi Cards 1
customfunctions: 8 Custom Functions with 24 settings settable in the camera
batterylife: Camera Body Only: Shooting Method Temp. AE 100% AE 50% FA 50% Viewfinder Shooting 23° C ~550 Shots ~440 Shots 0° C ~470 Shots ~400 Shots Live View Shooting 23° C ~200 Shots ~180 Shots 0° C ~170 Shots ~150 Shots With the optional Battery Grip BG-E8 Installed: (For Battery Grip BG-E8 with 1 Battery installed, see above chart.) Shooting Method Battery Temp. AE 100% AE 50% FA 50% Viewfinder Shooting 2x LP-E6 23° C ~1,100 ~880 0° C ~940 ~800 Size AA / LR6 Alkalines 23° C ~470 ~270 0° C ~130 ~80 Live View Shooting 2x LP-E6 23° C ~400 ~360 0° C ~340 ~300 Size AA / LR6 Alkalines 23° C ~180 ~150 0° C ~30 ~30
recordingformat: Complies with design rules: Camera File System 2.0, Exif 2.30
filesize: [Full HD] 1920 x 1080 (30 fps/25fps/24fps): 330 MB/min. HD: 1280 x 720 (60 fps/50fps): 330 MB/minute SD: 640 x 480 (30 fps/25fps): 82.5 MB/minute
autowhitebalance: Auto White Balance with the Image Sensor
filenumbering: Three different types of file numbers can be set: 1) Continuous Numbering - The numbering of captured images will continue even after you replace the camera's card. 2) Auto Reset - When you replace the camera's card, the numbering will be reset to start from 0001. If the new card already contains images, the numbering will continue from the last recorded image in the card. 3) Manual Reset - Resets the file number to 0001, and creates a new folder automatically.
imageformat: Still: JPEG, RAW, RAW+JPEG Video: MOV (MPEG-4 AVC / H.264)
focusing: 1) One-shot AF 2) Servo AF 3) Manual Focus - Magnify the image by ~5x or ~10x and focus manually. AF using AF point selection: i. Face Detection plus Tracking AF ii. FlexiZone - Multi - 31 zones - AF at the touched zone iii. FlexiZone - Single
dustdeletionfeature: 1) Self Cleaning Sensor Unit Removes dust adhering to the low-pass filter.  Self-cleaning executed automatically (takes ~2 seconds) when power is turned on or off. Manual execution also possible and takes ~8 seconds. 2) Dust Delete Data acquisition and appending - The coordinates of the dust adhering to the low-pass filter are detected by a test shot and appended to subsequent images. -The dust coordinate data appended to the image is used by the provided software to automatically erase the dust spots. 3) Manual cleaning
afpoints: 9 points All AF points are cross-type at f/5.6, Center AF point is diagonal cross-type at f/2.8
focusingmodes: 1) Autofocus One-Shot AF Predictive AI Servo AF AI Focus AF (One-Shot AF and AI Servo AF) 2) Manual Focus (MF)
usbterminal: 1) Personal Computer Transfers, PictBridge 2)           Audio (stereo) / Video (NTSC/PAL) output 3)           To connect a GP-E2 GPS Receiver
exposurecompensation: Provided (±3 stops in 1/3-stop increments) -   For video, exposure compensation will not be applied beyond ±3 stops. -   For still photo shooting, the exposure compensation can be set and applied up to ±5 stops.
selectedafpointdisplay: Indicated by superimposed display in the viewfinder and on the LCD monitor
startuptime: ~0.1 second, based on CIPA testing standards
continuousshooting: Maximum: ~5.0 fps with One-Shot AF or AI Servo AF
videooutterminal: Type C (Switches automatically to suit the resolution and TV) Video output: 1080/60i, 1080/50i, 480/60p, 576/50p
meteringmodes: Real-time Evaluative metering with the image sensor: 1) Evaluative metering (315 zones) 2) Partial metering (8.8% of Live View screen) 3) Spot metering (2.8% of Live View screen) 4) Center-weighted average metering - AE lock possible. The active metering time can be changed.
flashmetering: E-TTL II autoflash, evaluative flash & average flash metering
printableimages: RAW & JPEG images complying to Design rule for Camera File System
monitorsize: 77mm (3.0") Screen aspect ratio of 3:2 77mm Diagonal; 63.7mm wide, 42.5mm high
lowpassfilter: Fixed position in front of the image sensor
viewfinderinformation: 1) AF information (AF points and focus confirmation light) 2) Exposure information (Shutter speed, aperture, ISO speed (always displayed), AE lock, exposure level, spot metering circle, exposure warning) 3) Flash information (Flash ready, flash exposure compensation, high-speed sync, FE lock, red-eye reduction light) 4) Image information (Highlight tone priority (D+), monochrome shooting, maximum burst (1-digit display), white balance correction, SD card information)
displayformat: 1) Single Image Display: Single image, basic information, detailed information, histogram display. 2) Index display: 4, 9, 36, or 100 images 3) Jump display: Image jump with Main Dial 1, 10 or 100 images, shooting date, by folder, movies only, stills only, by rating
maximumburst: Based on 8GB memory Card: JPEG Large/Fine: ~ 22 Shots RAW: ~ 6 Shots RAW+JPEG Large/Fine: 3 Shots Based on 8GB UHS-I memory card: JPEG Large/Fine: ~ 30 Shots RAW: ~ 6 Shots RAW + JPEG Large/Fine: 3 Shots - Figures are based on Canon?s testing standards (ISO 100 and Standard Picture Style). - At ISO 12800, maximum burst will greatly decrease due to internal processing.
